exercise.instruction: Do these sentences suggest that the speaker’s belief was right: yes (Y) or no (N)?
exercise.question: I THOUGHT Anna would phone.Y
I thought Anna would PHONE.N
I HAD thought Anna would phone.N

exercise.instruction: Right (R) or wrong (W) in standard British English?
exercise.question: The car wants cleaned.W
The car wants cleaning.R
The car wants a clean.R

exercise.instruction: Are these sentences correct: yes (Y) or no (N)?
exercise.question: I wish I spoke Arabic.Y
I wish I were better looking.Y
I wish you would go home.Y
I wish you weren’t leaving so soon.Y
I wish I felt better tomorrow.N
I wish you wouldn’t drive so fast.Y
I wish you didn’t drive so fast.Y

exercise.instruction: Right (R) or wrong (W)?
exercise.question: The car isn’t worth repairing.R
It isn’t worth repairing the car.R
The car isn’t worth repairing it.W
The car isn’t worth to be repaired.W
